      • isAlertIsBeingShown

        protected final boolean isAlertIsBeingShown()
        Returns true if currently some modal dialog is being shown. While dialog is being shown, camera frames are not going to recognition.
        Returns:

      • setAlertIsBeingShown

        protected final void setAlertIsBeingShown(boolean alertIsBeingShown)
        Sets whether currently some modal dialog is being shown. While dialog is being shown, camera frames are not going to recognition.
        Parameters:
        alertIsBeingShown -

      • setRecognitionTimeout

        protected final void setRecognitionTimeout(int seconds)
        Set the recognition timeout in seconds. If valid payment data does not come from within given amount of seconds from this very moment, onRecognitionDoneWithTimeout event of RecognitionCallback will be fired.
        Parameters:
        seconds -

        protected final void resetRecognitionState()
        Resets the recognizer state, i.e. deletes the cached data from multiple recognitions.

      • onCameraImage

        public final void onCameraImage(byte[] imgData,
                 net.photopay.hardware.camera.CameraDataFormat dataFormat,
                 android.hardware.Camera.Size imageSize,
                 boolean isFrameSharp)
        Callback which is called when camera frame is ready.
        Parameters:
        imgData - Camera frame bytes
        dataFormat - Describes the format of imgData.
        imageSize - The size of camera frame.
        isFrameSharp - Whether or not the frame is in focus (sharp).

      • isOrientationAllowed

        protected abstract boolean isOrientationAllowed(Orientation orientation)
        Called in onOrientationChange. Use it to determine if given orientation is allowed.
        Parameters:
        orientation - Orientation of the device.
        Returns:
        true if orientation is allowed, otherwise false

      • createRecognitionCallback

        protected abstract net.photopay.ocr.PhotopayWrapper.RecognitionCallback createRecognitionCallback()
        Use this method to create implementation of RecognitionCallback interface that will handle recognition done events.
        Returns:
        Recognition callback.

      • requireAutofocusFeature

        protected abstract boolean requireAutofocusFeature()
        If autofocus feature is required, please return true from this method. If autofocus feature is not required, return false. If autofocus is required and device does not support autofocus, error will be raised and application will not start. If autofocus is not required, application will work even on devices without autofocus.
        Returns:
        True if autofocus is required, otherwise false.

      • onDecodeExtras

        protected abstract void onDecodeExtras(android.os.Bundle extras)
        Called inside onCreate method with extras that were provided via Intent. If you need to read some specific extras besides the default that are read in base use this method. Also you can set up cameraFactorySettings in this method.
        Parameters:
        extras - extras from Intent

      • onCreateViewFinder

        protected abstract IViewFinder onCreateViewFinder()
        Called inside onCreate method before building CameraPreview View. This method should build and return a class implementing IViewFinder interface that will handle various recognition events, such as detection position, and similar. If you return null, no overlay will be put on camera preview.
        Returns:
        viewfinder implementation

      • onCreateCameraFactorySettings

        protected abstract CameraFactorySettings onCreateCameraFactorySettings()
        Called inside onCreate method before creating camera manager. Use this method to create camera factory settings that are used on each resume event.
        Returns:
        Camera factory settings

      • onCreateCameraManager

        protected abstract CameraManager onCreateCameraManager(CameraFactorySettings settings,
                                  AutofocusStatusView afsv)
        Called inside onCreate method. This method should build appropriate camera manager for camera preview.
        Parameters:
        settings - camera factory settings as returned by onCreateCameraFactorySettings
        afsv - Interface for handling camera focus events.
        Returns:
        Appropriate camera manager.

      • isProgressBarEnabled

        protected abstract boolean isProgressBarEnabled()
        This is called inside onCreate when instatiating payment recognizer delegate. It must know whether or not it should report progress updates.
        Returns:

      • onShouldLoadNativeRecognizer

        protected abstract boolean onShouldLoadNativeRecognizer()
        Called in onStart. If returned true, native recognizer will be loaded. Return false if you plan to immediately finish the activity to prevent unnecessary expensive loading of native library.
        Returns:
        true if native recognizer will be loaded

      • onBeforeLoadingCamera

        protected abstract boolean onBeforeLoadingCamera()
        Called inside onResume method just before loading the camera
        Returns:
        true if base activity should continue with loading, false if not (e.g. if start of another activity has been initiated)

      • onSetupViewFinder

        protected abstract void onSetupViewFinder(IViewFinder viewfinder)
        Called inside onResume method after camera has been loaded and recognition loop has been enabled. Use this method to place your viewfinder in default position.
        Parameters:
        viewfinder -

      • onAfterPause

        protected abstract void onAfterPause()
        Called as last thing inside onPause. Use it for terminations of your objects before going to pause.
